title._content: ["Jones Wood" townhouses, East 65th and East 66th Streets between Lexington and Third Avenues, New York, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Jones Wood" townhouses, East 65th and East 66th Streets between Lexington and Third Avenues, New York, New York. Reflecting pool on south terrace] [1921] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Twelve townhouses designed by John B. Snook, 1868, and remodeled by Edward Shepard Hewitt and William Emerson, 1919. Landscape: Edward Shepard Hewitt and William Emerson. Other: Originally known as "Gerry Gardens." Today: Extant. Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. On slide: Blue star sticker and red seal sticker. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16184 Call Number: LC-J717-X99- 26
